abstracts.cdata!:
This study reviews the environmental
            impact on the eight irrigation and drainage subprojects
            under the Second Irrigation and Drainage Rehabilitation
            Project in Albania. It analyzes the relatively narrow
            environmental impact of the proposed irrigation
            rehabilitation, emphasizing a wider impact on the
            surrounding environment, since the long-term impact on the
            subprojects' viability is of higher relevance. The
            study includes eight volumes, considering, in general,
            positive assessments on the impacts of the rehabilitation of
            deteriorated irrigation and drainage facilities. In
            particular, the rehabilitation will restore efficient
            irrigation and increase farm incomes among an impoverished
            rural population. Drainage will facilitate growth in the
            cooler months, reducing fertilizer and agro-chemical
            run-offs. However, soil erosion from surrounding areas is a
            major environmental concern, and it is expected to be
            addressed through the proposed watershed management
            component. This component will also address the soil
            salinity issue, which, even though salinity may not be
            present in most subproject areas, adjacent slope watershed
            areas may contain infertile acid soils, conducive to poor
            quality vegetation and high erosion degrees. To mitigate
            these impacts, the study suggests the need for irrigation
            and water quality to be monitored annually. Drainage water
            samples should be analyzed for pesticide residues.
